# splitView(_:shouldHideDividerAt:)

**Instance Method**

Allows the split view controller to determine whether the user can drag a divider or adjust it off the edge of the split view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func splitView(_ splitView: NSSplitView, shouldHideDividerAt dividerIndex: Int) -> Bool
```

## Discussion

By default, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSplitViewController] hides the first and last dividers if their outer neighbor is in a collapsed state.

## Configuring and Drawing View Dividers

- **splitView(_:effectiveRect:forDrawnRect:ofDividerAt:)**: Allows the split view controller to modify the rectangle where mouse clicks initiate divider dragging.
- **splitView(_:additionalEffectiveRectOfDividerAt:)**: Allows the split view controller to return an additional rectangle where mouse clicks can initiate divider dragging.
